title: How to Delete a Flickr Account

steps.headline: Log into Flickr with your Yahoo email and password.
steps.description: Deleting your Flickr account removes your uploaded photos and account settings while preserving your Yahoo account. Note: if you have a Flickr Pro subscription, you'll first need to cancel your subscription to avoid accidental charges.

steps.headline: If you have a Flickr Pro subscription, open "Settings" from the camera icon and click "View your order history".
steps.description: Your order history is under the "Personal Information" tab.

steps.headline: To cancel Flickr Pro, click the garbage can icon next to your subscription.
steps.description: The can should be next to a line with your subscription type (Pro) and duration (e.g., 1 year).

steps.headline: Click "You" in the tool bar to return to your Flickr page.
Click "Camera Roll" .
Download any photos you want to keep.
steps.description: Do this by selecting the desired photos, then clicking "Download" in the menu at the bottom of your screen. When you delete your Flickr, your photos will also be deleted. You can also click "Select All" next to the photos' date of origin to select multiple photos for download.

steps.headline: Delete any photos you don't want Google to archive.
steps.description: Do this by selecting the photos for deletion, then clicking "Delete" in the menu at the bottom of your screen. Although deleting your Flickr also deletes your photos, Google sometimes saves and displays screenshots of deleted pages. Deleting your photos before closing your account means your photos won't appear in the archived screenshot.

steps.headline: Click "settings", then scroll down to the "Your Flickr account" section.
Click "Delete your Flickr account".
steps.description: Read through the resulting text to make sure you are completely ready to delete your account, then click "OK".

steps.headline: Enter your Flickr password.
Click "next", then click "Yes, I fully understand".
steps.description: You will still have to confirm your account deletion on the next screen.

steps.headline: Click "Delete my account".
steps.description: Your account is gone! To verify that the process worked, try typing your credentials into Flickr and clicking "Sign in". Your login credentials should no longer work.

steps.headline: Log into your Yahoo account with your email and password.
steps.description: If you want to start over with an entirely new profile in both Yahoo and Flickr, deleting your Yahoo account is a bit quicker than deleting each one individually. Closing your Yahoo account will also close any services associated with Yahoo--for example, Flickr. If you have a Flickr Pro account, you'll need to log into Flickr directly and cancel your paid subscription before deleting your Yahoo account. You can do this by visiting your Flickr's "Order History" tab.

steps.headline: Click "More on Yahoo" under the "More" link.
steps.description: You'll find this option in the tool bar on the left-hand side of the screen.

steps.headline: Find and click on "Help".
Under "I need help with", click on "Account".
steps.description: This page may take a few moments to load.

steps.headline: Scroll down to the "I need help with" section.
Click on the "Browse by topic" menu, then click "create or delete account".
Select the "Close your Yahoo account" option.
Click the "'Terminating your Yahoo account' page" link.
Enter your Yahoo password.
steps.description: This should be the same password you use to log into Yahoo.

steps.headline: Click "Next", then continue to the "Terminating your Yahoo Account" page.
Re-enter your password, then confirm by entering a captcha code.
steps.description: You will still have to confirm your account deletion in the next window. If you struggle with visual captcha codes, you can also select the "audio" option right above the code window.

steps.headline: Click "YES - Terminate this account".
steps.description: Your account should be gone! To verify your account deletion, try logging into Yahoo as well as Flickr. Your login credentials should no longer work.

text: Deleting Your Flickr Account Log into Flickr with your Yahoo email and password. Deleting your Flickr account removes your uploaded photos and account settings while preserving your Yahoo account. Note: if you have a Flickr Pro subscription, you'll first need to cancel your subscription to avoid accidental charges. If you have a Flickr Pro subscription, open "Settings" from the camera icon and click "View your order history". Your order history is under the "Personal Information" tab. To cancel Flickr Pro, click the garbage can icon next to your subscription. The can should be next to a line with your subscription type (Pro) and duration (e.g., 1 year). Click "You" in the tool bar to return to your Flickr page.  Click "Camera Roll" . This will open your account. Download any photos you want to keep. Do this by selecting the desired photos, then clicking "Download" in the menu at the bottom of your screen. When you delete your Flickr, your photos will also be deleted. You can also click "Select All" next to the photos' date of origin to select multiple photos for download. Delete any photos you don't want Google to archive. Do this by selecting the photos for deletion, then clicking "Delete" in the menu at the bottom of your screen. Although deleting your Flickr also deletes your photos, Google sometimes saves and displays screenshots of deleted pages. Deleting your photos before closing your account means your photos won't appear in the archived screenshot. Click "settings", then scroll down to the "Your Flickr account" section.  Click "Delete your Flickr account". Read through the resulting text to make sure you are completely ready to delete your account, then click "OK". Enter your Flickr password.  Click "next", then click "Yes, I fully understand". You will still have to confirm your account deletion on the next screen. Click "Delete my account". Your account is gone! To verify that the process worked, try typing your credentials into Flickr and clicking "Sign in". Your login credentials should no longer work. Deleting Your Yahoo Account Log into your Yahoo account with your email and password. If you want to start over with an entirely new profile in both Yahoo and Flickr, deleting your Yahoo account is a bit quicker than deleting each one individually. Closing your Yahoo account will also close any services associated with Yahoo--for example, Flickr. If you have a Flickr Pro account, you'll need to log into Flickr directly and cancel your paid subscription before deleting your Yahoo account. You can do this by visiting your Flickr's "Order History" tab. Click "More on Yahoo" under the "More" link. You'll find this option in the tool bar on the left-hand side of the screen. Find and click on "Help".  Under "I need help with", click on "Account". This page may take a few moments to load. Scroll down to the "I need help with" section.  Click on the "Browse by topic" menu, then click "create or delete account".  Select the "Close your Yahoo account" option.  Click the "'Terminating your Yahoo account' page" link.  Enter your Yahoo password. This should be the same password you use to log into Yahoo. Click "Next", then continue to the "Terminating your Yahoo Account" page.  Re-enter your password, then confirm by entering a captcha code. You will still have to confirm your account deletion in the next window. If you struggle with visual captcha codes, you can also select the "audio" option right above the code window. Click "YES - Terminate this account". Your account should be gone! To verify your account deletion, try logging into Yahoo as well as Flickr. Your login credentials should no longer work.
